numlitem.para: At least two FCC power circuit breakers remain IN,
Associated FCC SERVO circuit breakers are pulled and collared,
If FCC Single Source option is installed, Autopilot Flight Director System is verified not in a single source configuration prior to each departure, and
Approach minimums do not require their use.

note.para: Single Source Configuration is installed on N436UP-N475UP.

numlitem.para: If autopilot engagement between 200’ and 500’ AGL is desired, ensure the AFDS is fully operational.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 1.
One Autopilot and associated Autoflight Director System (AFDS) required for dispatch to charted ILS CAT 1 minimums below RVR 4000 or 3/4 mile visibility.

note.para: For operations to Central, South American and Mexico destinations ONLY, the flight may not depart outbound domestic gateways with two inoperative Autopilot Systems, but may continue series of flights for repair interval specified in Repair Int Category section.

placard.para: Placard affected A/P Engage switch(es) "INOP" or "MODE(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Two Systems Inoperative (N436UP-N475UP) RR

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6).

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

note.para: Deferring a leaking Autopilot Electrohydraulic Servo Valve requires deactivating the associated Autopilot System.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the applicable Flight Control Computer (FCC) servo circuit breaker on the P-11 overhead panel and placard.

Verify minimum number of FCC 115 VAC circuit breakers on the P11 overhead panel are closed for dispatch configuration. Dispatch is allowed if an inoperative FCC has a fault that trips it's circuit breaker provided the minimum number of FCC circuit breakers are closed, however, sensor data availability is maximized if all FCC breakers are closed.

note.para: "Single Source" refers to single source of either inertial reference or stabilizer position data. The FCC Single Source option allows autopilot engagement in the air in a single source configuration after inflight sensor failures.
IRUs should be aligned to complete the following steps:

numlitem.para: Check the Autoland Status Annunciator on the instrument panel.
If autoland status is "NO LAND 3" or blank, AFDS is not in a single source configuration. No further single source tests are necessary.
If autoland status in "NO AUTOLAND", AFDS may be in a single source configuration and steps 2 and 3 must be accomplished.

note.para: If the FCC Single Source option is installed, a single source configuration can be detected using the Maintenance Control Display Panel (MCDP). If FCC Single Source option is known NOT to be installed, the MCDP test below is not required since it will not detect a single source configuration. If an actual single source configuration exists and FCC Single Source option is not installed, autopilot engagement will be inhibited in the air.

numlitem.para: In the main equipment center, or using optional flight deck controls, turn MCDP Power ON.

Verify message "SINGLE SOURCE" is not displayed at power up. If this message is displayed, AFDS is in a single source configuration and dispatch with autopilot operation is not permitted. Dispatch may be conducted by considering all autopilots inoperative.

note.para: The following steps should be accomplished only if the Autopilot System is to be deferred for a hydraulic leak.

numlitem.para: Autopilot Electrohydraulic Servo Valves (EHSV) Leaking:

note.para: The following procedure is generic for the three Elevator Autopilot Servo (EAS) Electrohydraulic Valves and the three Directional Autopilot Servo (DAS) Electrohydraulic Valves.

numlitem.para: Remove applicable hydraulic pressure at panel P5.
Left EAS/DAS - Left hydraulic system.
Center EAS/DAS - Center hydraulic system.
Right EAS/DAS - Right hydraulic system.
Set panel P61 switches L, C, R TAIL FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF to OFF.
Set the two P10 control stand STAB TRIM switches to CUTOUT.
Set the Mode Control Panel F/D switches to OFF.
Open the following circuit breakers on the P11 panel:

entry.para: FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF TAIL L, C, R
FLT CONT CMPTR PWR L, C, R
FLT CONT CMPTR SERV L, C, R

numlitem.para: Gain access to the leaky EAS/DAS (Autopilot servo).
Remove the pressure and return lines from the autopilot servo.
Cap autopilot servo ports with BACC14AG plugs or equivalent.
Cap the hydraulic lines with MS21914 or BAC14AD 3,000 psi (CRES or titanium) caps or equivalent.
Close the circuit breakers from step E.
Set MCP F/D switches to ON.
Set STAB TRIM switches to NORM.
Set L, C, R TAIL FLT CONTROL SHUTOFF to ON.
Perform the steps under "Autopilot Inoperative", in following for the number of autopilots rendered inoperative.
